intro: Lecythis pachysepala, commonly known as the thick-shelled balsa, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, thick-walled fruits that contain a single, heavy seed. The plant belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid, lowland environments. Its bark and wood have been used by indigenous communities for various purposes, including construction and traditional medicine. The plant also plays a vital role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by providing food and shelter for numerous species.
